title: Header Title
custom_preconds: Given the user is in Event Details
custom_expected: Then the user will  always see 'Event Details'

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see a back button to the very left
And "Event detail" text right next to it

title: Event Information
custom_preconds: Given the user is in Event Details
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the team names as Away vs. Home
And each team's correct logo will be shown (check all teams)
And below that will be the Game Date (format: Saturday, Sept 29)
And next to the Game Date will be the Game Time (format: 12:05 p.m.)
And below that will be the Venue name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the event detail view of a game that has no yet started
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the event information
And team logo should appear on the opposite sides with the home team on the right side
And the center should show the 2 team names in bold following this format
*METS @ YANKEES*
And below that should show the date and time of the event
And below that should show the ballpark name

title: 1_EDITED Event Links Pre-/In-Game State
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details (either via Ballpark Guide, Game OR Navigate to Journal, History, Select a Game)
And the event is in a Pre-/In-Game state

ORIGINAL:
Given the user is in Event Details
And the event is in a Pre-/In-Game state
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a button for Check In
And a button for MyTickets or Tickets depending on ballpark config
And a button for Upgrade Seats when applicable
And these buttons will be centered with equal spacing when present

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the Event Information
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the check in button
And the offer section

title: 1_EDITED Event Links Post-Game State (Journal)
custom_preconds:
Navigate to Journal
Given the user is in Event Details
And the event is in a Post-Game state

ORIGINAL:
Given the user is in Event Details
And the event is in a Post-Game state
custom_expected: Then the user will see a View Game Wrap button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the Event Information
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the "view game wrap" button

title: Non Game Events
custom_preconds: AND the user navigates to the the Events Detail page
custom_expected: The Non Game Event, Event Detail page will be launched

custom_steps_separated.content:
User has not checked into NGE 
AND navigates to the event detail page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The Events details page will be launched
AND there will be a "More Information" link

custom_steps_separated.content:
User has successfully checked in to the NGE
AND navigates to the event details page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The Events details page will be launched
AND there will be a "More Information" link

title: Event Links - Check-In button  - Outside of Check In Window
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And the event is in a Pre-Game state
And it is greater than 3 hours to game time
custom_expected: The Check-in button will be inactive (Greyed out)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user tries to access the Check In button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the button, and it will be greyed out.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user tries to access the Check In button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a message indicating that the device is outside of the check-in window.

title: Event Links - Check-In button - Inside of Check In Window
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And the event is in a Pre-/In-Game state
And it is within 3 hours to game time
custom_expected:
Then the button will not be greyed out
And the button will be tappable
And tapping the button will lead the user through the Check-In flow

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user tries to access the Check In button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the button enabled
and the user will be able to tap it to enter the check-in flow

title: Event Links - My Tickets button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details view of a game that is in the future(not upcoming or current)
And ticketsAndroidEnabled is present in ballpark config
And ticketsURL is present in ballpark config
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the 'Buy Tickets' button (button name can be configured using ballpark config - ticketsURLText)
And tapping on this button will open a Standard Webview using the URL specified

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at Event Links
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it should show buy tickets, upgrades, manage links in caps

title: Event Links - Tickets button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details view of a game that is in the future(not upcoming or current)
And ticketsURL is present in ballpark config
And there is the appropriate link attached
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a 'Tickets' button
And tapping it displays the Native Webview for current game's ticket flow

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at Event Links
And taps on the buy ticket link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the ticketsurl webpage displayed on the ballpark webview

title: Event Links - Upgrade Seats button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details view of a game that is in the future(not upcoming or current)
And upgradeURL is present in ballpark config
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the 'Upgrade Seats' button
And tapping it displays a Standard Webview to the URL specified

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the Event Links
And tap on the upgrade button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be directed to the upgrade URL

title: Event Links - No Upgrade Seats button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details for a future game
And upgradeURL is not present in ballpark config
custom_expected: Then the user will not see an 'Upgrade Seats' button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the Event Links
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should not see an upgrade button in the event links

title: 1_EDITED Event Links - View Game Wrap (Journal)
custom_preconds:
Navigate to the Journal
Given the user is in Event Details
And the event is in a Post-Game state

ORIGINAL:
Given the user is in Event Details
And the event is in a Post-Game state
custom_expected: Then the user will only see a 'View Game Wrap' button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the Event Links
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the "view the game wrap"

title: App Links Pre-/In-Game State
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And the event is in a pre-/in-game state
custom_expected:
Then there will be a link to 'Follow the game in At Bat'
And these links will have icons
And the entire row for these links will be tappable

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the Event Links
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the At Bat promo

title: 1_EDITED App Links Post-Game State
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details (via the Journal)
And the event is in a post-game state


ORIGINAL:
Given the user is in Event Details
And the event is in a post-game state
custom_expected: Then there will be no links to other apps

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the Event Links
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should not see an app link
and the user should see the "view the game wrap"
And the user should see the photos section
And the user should see the game hightlights

title: App Links - At Bat not installed
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And has navigated to the App Links section
And At Bat is not installed on the device
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to At Bat application in the App Store

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on At Bat
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be directed to the at bat play store page

title: App Links - At Bat installed
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And has navigated to the App Links section
And At Bat is installed on the device
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the Gameday screen for that specific game in At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on At Bat
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the gameday view for that event on the at bat app

title: 1_EDITED Your Photos - No Photos
custom_preconds:
Given the user in in Event Details
And has not added any Photos to the event
Checkin is not required

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the game details
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see 'Photos'

custom_steps_separated.content: When there will be a message 'Add A Photo', and a Camera icon. tap on it
custom_steps_separated.expected: And tapping it will take you to the photos page and the user will be able to add a photo

title: 1_EDITED Your Photos - Recent Photos
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And the user is checked in
And has added 1 or more Photos to the event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the Your Photos section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see their 12 most recent photos
And the photos will be in order from newest to oldest.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a photo
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then this will open the Gallery

title: 1_EDITED Your Photos - See All
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And has added 1 or more Photos to the event
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Gallery

ORIGINAL:
Then the user will see a 'See All' button on the far right of the Your Photos cell
And tapping it will take the user to the Gallery

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the Your Photos section
And the user taps on the photo thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the photos view
and all the photos should be displayed there

title: 1_EDITED In-Game Highlights
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the Event Details (either via Ballpark Guide, Game OR Navigate to Journal, History, Select a Game)

ORIGINAL:
Given the user is in Event Details
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a section labeled 'Games Highlights'
And the 3 most recent highlight videos will be displayed below
And each video cell will include the highlight's title, length, and date

ORIGINAL:
Then the user will see a section labeled 'Highlights'
And there will be a 'See All' button on the far right of the Highlights cell
And the 3 most recent highlight videos will be displayed below
And each video cell will include the highlight's title, date/time, & length

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the Your Photos section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the game highlight section
And the game highlights should all be loaded with no "see all" button

title: 1_EDITED In-Game Highlights - Playing a Video
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details (either via Ballpark Guide, Game OR Navigate to Journal, History, Select a Game)

ORIGINAL:
Given the user is in Event Details
custom_expected:
Then the video player will open
And that specific highlight will play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps on a video cell in the Games Highlights section

ORIGINAL:
When the user taps on a Video cell in the Highlights section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the video end level
And the video will start playing

title: your photos - upload
custom_preconds:
Given user wants to upload from the event details
And the user is on the event detail view
And the user is looking at the photos section in the event detail

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the photo icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be prompted options to add from device gallery or take a new photo

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the photo icon
And the user has selected a photo to upload
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user's photo will be uploaded
And the user will see the photo appear under the photo section next to the photo icon

title: 1_EDITED Header Title Non-game
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And it is a non-game Event
custom_expected: Then the user will always see 'Event Details'

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see a back button
and the user should also see "event detail"

title: 1_EDITED Event Information
custom_preconds:
Homebase is a CMS tool that is used to manage and publish changes to the Ballpark config file. Changes made in Homebase should be reflected on the app in the section called 'Extras'.

Work with anyone who can administer Homebase

Given the user is in Event Details
And it is a non-game Event

ORIGINAL:
Given the user is in Event Details
And it is a non-game Event
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the Event Name
And below that will be the Event Date (format: Sat, Sep 29)
And next to the Game Date will be the Event Start Time (format: 12:05 p.m.)
And below that will be the Venue name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content loads
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the event information modified

title: 1_EDITED Event Content - Image
custom_preconds:
Homebase is a CMS tool that is used to manage and publish changes to the Ballpark config file. Changes made in Homebase should be reflected on the app in the section called 'Extras'.

Work with anyone who can administer Homebase

Given the user is in Event Details
And it is a non-game Event

ORIGINAL:

Given the user is in Event Details
And it is a non-game Event
custom_steps: When an Image for the event is available
custom_expected: Then the Image will be displayed below the Event Information

title: 1_EDITED Original: Your Photos - No Photos / New: Your Photos - No Photos Non-Game
custom_preconds:
Given the user in in Event Details
And it is a non-game Event
And has not added any Photos to the event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks below the App Links
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see 'Your Photos'

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a message ' add some photos', and a camera icon, tap on it
custom_steps_separated.expected: And tapping it will take you to the Choose Image menu with options of Camera, Photo Library, and Cancel

title: 1_EDITED Original: Your Photos - Recent Photos / New: Your Photos - Recent Photos Non-Game
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And it is a non-game Event
And has added 1 or more Photos to the event

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks at the Your Photos section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see their photos
And the photos will be in order from newest to oldest
And the user will be able to scroll through them

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a photo
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then this will open the Gallery

title: 1_EDITED Original: Your Photos - See All / New: Your Photos - See All Non-game
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in Event Details
And it is a non-game Event
And has added 1 or more Photos to the event
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Gallery

ORIGINAL:
Then the user will see a 'See All' button on the far right of the Your Photos cell
And tapping it will take the user to the Gallery

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the Your Photos section
Then the user will see a 'See All' button on the far right of the Your Photos cell
Tap on it

ORIGINAL:
When the user looks at the Your Photos section
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be brought to that events gallery

title: 1_EDITED Original: Title of Alert (pop-up) / New: Title of Alert
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in
And the user has added a game to their history
And the user has navigated to the Event Detail screen for that game
custom_expected:
Then the title of the alert will be 'Delete Game'
 
ORIGINAL:
Then the title of the alert pop-up will be 'Delete Game'

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the Remove button
And the alert loads

ORIGINAL:
When the user clicks the Remove button
And the alert loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see the message
and the user will see the delete game button

title: 1_EDITED Back button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in
And the user has added a game to their history
And the user has navigated to the Event Detail screen for that game
And the user has clicked Remove
custom_expected:
Then the user will be brought back to History Screen

ORIGINAL:
Then the user will be brought back to that Event Detail Screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user clicks the up button
Or taps the device hardware back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should be redirected to the journal

title: 1_EDITED Remove Game Text with no Photos attached
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in
And the user has added a game to their history
And there are no photos attached
And the user has navigated to the Event Detail screen for that game
And the user has tapped Remove

ORIGINAL:
Given the user is logged in
And the user has added a game to their history
And there are no photos attached
And the user has navigated to the Event Detail screen for that game
And the user has clicked Remove
custom_expected:
Then the user will see an alert appear
And the alert will contain the message of: "The following game will be deleted from your history:"
And the details of the game you are removing exist below

custom_steps_separated.content: When the content on the screen loads
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user game should be successfully removed along with the images

title: 1_EDITED Remove Game Text with at least 1 photo attached
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in
And the user has added a game to their history
And have attached at least 1 photo to this game
And the user has navigated to the Event Detail screen for that game
And the user has clicked Remove
And the user views the Delete Game alert

ORIGINAL:
Given the user is logged in
And the user has added a game to their history
And have attached at least 1 photo to this game
And the user has navigated to the Event Detail screen for that game
And the user has clicked Remove
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the game removed from their history
And the user will not see any trace of that photo attached within the app

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user confirms to remove the game from their History
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user should have the game removed from history along with the photo

title: 1_EDITED Remove game from my history button
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in
And the user has added a game to their history
And the user has navigated to the Event Detail screen for that game
And the user has tapped Remove
And the user views the Delete Game verification


ORIGINAL:
Given the user is logged in
And the user has added a game to their history
And the user has navigated to the Event Detail screen for that game
And the user has clicked Remove
custom_expected: Then the game will be removed from their history

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps Delete Game

ORIGINAL:
When the user clicks Remove game from my history
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user should see the message "successfully updated"
And the game should be deleted
